intro: Rotala indica var. koreana, commonly known as Korean water hyssop, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its dense, floating foliage and small blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in shallow freshwater habitats such as ponds and slow-moving streams. It has finely toothed leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Rotala indica var. koreana is often used in aquatic gardening and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to provide habitat for aquatic life.
